content: pic 8 leave a tail of 8 -10 inches for seaming the top of head to the bottom later then work the row below back and forth slipping the first st of each row as before 8 9 1 slip 1 p6 6 ssk k1 k2tog 3 sts 2 slip 1 k6 7 slip 1 p2 3 slip 1 p6 8 slip 1 k2tog 2 sts 4 ssk k3 k2tog 5 sts 9 p2tog 1 st 5 slip 1 p4 cut yarn thread through last st and weave in loose end on p side the top of your songbird s head is now seamed to the bottom with the color b tail to keep these sts from being seen in the color a section insert darning needle through a little stich underneath the top section instead of in the outer edge pic 9 hold both pieces in place with one hand while seaming with the other seam up one side to about 1/4 inch from the tip for an open beak pic 10 stuff body and head firmly then continue seaming down the other side until head is closed weave in loose end 10 7 wings make 2 your songbird s wings are knit in the round with color a co 8 sts onto 3 dpns and work rounds below 1 k all sts 2 k1 m1r k2 m1l k2 m1r k2 m1l k1 12 sts 3 k all sts 4 k all sts 5 k all sts 6 k1 m1r k4 m1l k2 m1r k4 m1l k1 16 sts 7 k all sts 8 k all sts 9 k all sts 10 k1 m1r k6 m1l k2 m1r k6 m1l k1 20 sts 11 k all sts 12 k all sts 13 k all sts 14 k2tog k to last 2 sts in round ssk 18 sts 15 k all sts repeat last 2 rounds until 10 sts remain ending after a plain k round then work the 3 rounds below to make the tip of the wing curve upward 1 k3 k2tog ssk k3 8 sts 2 k2 k2tog ssk k2 6 sts 3 k1 k2tog ssk k1 4 sts cut yarn thread through remaining live sts pull closed and weave in loose end seam front of wing to side of body pic 11 embroider eyes if desired additional embroidery can be added as well to the wings tail or head to resemble a particular breed of bird enjoy 11 8
